intro: Cryptotaeniopsis wolffiana, commonly known as the Wolff's cryptotaeniopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is native to South America, specifically found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
